dict.string: Paw is a full-featured HTTP client that lets you test APIs.
Paw needs to activate its license and install extensions. If you use [Paw Cloud](https://paw.cloud/), it will also synchronize your projects.

If you deny this connection, Paw won't be able to reach the licensing server and won't be running properly. Though, you can stay productive while on the go, as Paw works up to 14 days offline out of reach of the licensing server.
Paw uses [HockeyApp](https://hockeyapp.net/) to track app crashes. While crash reports are extremely valuable for us to improve Paw, it's your choice whether to send crash reports or not.
If you deny this connection, Paw won't be able to send crash reports.
Paw uses [Algolia](https://www.algolia.com/) (a cloud search service) to search for documentation articles and standard API definitions.
If you deny this connection, you won't be able to search for online documentation in the Help menu or for APIs definitions to import.
Paw uses [Firebase](https://firebase.google.com/) (a Google Cloud Platform service) to update Paw Cloud projects in real-time.
If you deny this connection, project syncing on Paw Cloud won't be working properly.
Paw needs to connect to the HTTP APIs you're testing.
If you deny this connection, you won't be able to test your HTTP APIs with Paw.
